meanings.definition: To cut or shape (wood) with a knife
meanings.sent1: He whittled a small boat out of a piece of wood.
meanings.sent2: She whittled a beautiful figurine from a block of wood.
meanings.sent3: The old man whittled a funny-looking bird that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: She whittled away at the wood until a delicate design emerged.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the knife whittling through the wood echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: To reduce or pare down gradually
meanings.sent1: She whittled her to-do list by crossing off completed tasks.
meanings.sent2: He whittled down his collection of books to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent3: The chef whittled the recipe to perfection by removing unnecessary ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were slowly whittled away by unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor whittled the marble block until only the essential shape remained.

meanings.definition: To carve or fashion something from wood by cutting small pieces from it
meanings.sent1: He whittled a tiny animal figurine with intricate details.
meanings.sent2: She whittled a set of wooden spoons for her kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The children whittled small toys from the fallen branches in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The artist whittled a stunning sculpture from a single block of wood.
meanings.sent5: The craftsman whittled away at the wood until a masterpiece emerged.
